thread.title: Mardi Gras Crash in Alabama Injures 12 Students in Marching Band
thread.title_full: Mardi Gras Crash in Alabama Injures 12 Students in Marching Band - The New York Times

author: Kalyn Wolfe and Matthew Haag
title: Mardi Gras Crash in Alabama Injures 12 Students in Marching Band
text:
Horrible start to Gulf Shores parade. Someone hit by a car. We'll keep you updated. pic.twitter.com/VaIS4UVBqZ — Michael White (@michaelwhitewx) Feb. 28, 2017 The driver stayed at the scene and was cooperating with the authorities, Mr. Brown said at a news conference Tuesday afternoon. Alcohol and drugs were not thought to be involved, Mr. Brown said.
Police officers and firefighters, who were already at the event, immediately responded and started to treat the students, Mr. Brown said. Photos posted on Twitter showed items scattered across the start of the parade route on State Highway 59.
Advertisement
  Gov. Robert Bentley of Alabama said he had directed the State Police to assist in the investigation.
On Saturday evening, a 25-year-old man plowed into spectators in New Orleans along a Mardi Gras parade route, injuring 28 people. The driver faces multiple charges, and the police said alcohol was involved.
#BREAKING : Following reports that a car drove into a crowd at a #MardiGras parade in Gulf Shores, #Alabama ; Injuries reported #LiveDesk pic.twitter.com/6JJGrW5xZH 
— Dan Snyder (@DanSnyderKOKH) Feb. 28, 2017 Kalyn Wolfe reported from Gulf Shores, Ala., and Matthew Haag from New York.
  We’re interested in your feedback on this page. Tell us what you think. 
Related Coverage Pickup Plows Into Crowd at a Mardi Gras Parade, Injuring 28 FEB. 25, 2017
